page.title: 16Wildlife Around Kinbrace
page.content: Kinbrace is a very interesting place for wildlife. It has several small areas of afforestation,a river and also a mixture of moorlands and man-made fields. There are two specially common species. One is the red grouse and the other is the red deer. These are both shot at certain times of the year by both landowners and game keepers. We have oystercatchers, golden plovers, lapwings,curlews,dippers,hawks,herons and buzzards and one might even see an eagle soaring on high! Also in our area are foxes,hares,rabbits and wildcats. The latter are now becoming very rare in Scotland. We see adders and grass snakes. Weasels,stoats and hedgehogs are fairly common. And sometimes if you are lucky you might see an otter swimming up the river.
